title: How to Pull an All Nighter in Your Room Alone (Kids)

steps.title: Get lots of sleep the night before.
steps.content: Get lots of sleep the night before. It's hard to sit up all night when your eyes are droopy and it's easier to fall asleep. [1] X Research source Make sure you sleep for around two hours or more than you normally would on a night.

steps.title: Have three healthy meals during the day.
steps.content: Have three healthy meals during the day. If you can, have snacks of fruit and vegetables in between. These will give you the energy needed. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Start preparing for the all-nighter.
steps.content: Start preparing for the all-nighter. If you have electronics, put them in your room and charge them if you plan on using them during the night. If you have a game console that's not in your room, put it there. Get some food, water, and soda or pop in your room as well.

steps.title: Go to bed as normal.
steps.content: Go to bed as normal. If you can, "sleep" with the TV on, so you'll have a little something to do until your parents go to bed. If you can't, try to stay awake!

steps.title: Wait for your parents to go to bed.
steps.content: Wait for your parents to go to bed. Then, whip out a small game console, such as a DS, DSi, 3DS, DS Lite, PSP, PS Vita, the Wii U Gamepad, Nintendo Switch, or any other small device you may have. Make sure to keep the volume low if you're in a small house or your parents are just light sleepers. If you don't have a small game console, watch TV. If you can't watch TV, read a book. Do anything you can to try to stay awake!

steps.title: Listen to some music.
steps.content: Listen to some music. Use an iPod, MP3 Player, or another music device, with headphones. Wait for about an hour after your parents go to bed, to be safe. If you can, try to keep one ear free so you can hear your parents if they get up. If none are available, listen to it at a low volume. Be careful! Don't wake up your parent(s)! Make sure to have a plan if they wake up to check on you or something like that, like stuff everything under a pillow or your sheets. Observe how you sleep and try to look like how you "normally" sleep. Wait a couple of minutes till you take out your devices or music just in case they come back.

steps.title: Eat something.
steps.content: Eat something. After a while, you're most likely to be hungry! Eat some of those snacks, water, and soda mentioned in step 2. Don't be too loud while eating, though! You could wake up your parent(s)! As a matter of fact, you should pre-plan your snacks so while you are making them you don't wake your parents. Maybe put them in your drawer or closet so they don't find them and question you or take them away. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Play games.
steps.content: Play games. Play some computer games. Play on game sites, or on a social networking site, if you have an account. If using social media, remember to follow the terms and conditions. If you are too young to have an account, don't make one as there are laws to protect children and their privacy rights. If you can, play some video games. Such as a PlayStation 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5, Wii, GameCube, Original Xbox, Xbox 360, or Xbox 1. Or, a Wii U, and you don't even have to turn the TV on. Remember––don't be too loud because your parents will still be awake.

steps.title: Listen to music.
steps.content: Listen to music. If you have headphones, listen to loud music. If none are available, then listen to it on a soft volume.

steps.title: Play with some toys.
steps.content: Play with some toys. Toys such as Barbies, cars, or Lego blocks.

steps.title: Read a book or something if you can.
steps.content: Read a book or something if you can. Exciting books, not boring ones.

steps.title: Watch TV.
steps.content: Watch TV. If you can, watch shows on demand or DVDs. Again, headphones are very helpful, so you don't awaken your parents.

steps.title: Play some games.
steps.content: Play some games. No telling what kind, but play a couple of games.

steps.title: Get up and do some stretches.
steps.content: Get up and do some stretches. Move around for 5-20 minutes. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Splash some cold water on your face.
steps.content: Splash some cold water on your face. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Eat snacks and drink more soda or pop/water.
steps.content: Eat snacks and drink more soda or pop/water.

steps.title: Splash a little more water on your face.
steps.content: Splash a little more water on your face.

steps.title: Switch to early morning TV watching.
steps.content: Switch to early morning TV watching. By now, morning cartoons should be on. Watch away. Now, go on with a morning routine. If your parents wake and ask why you're up, say you just woke up early or wanted to catch a certain morning cartoon.

steps.title: Watch the sunrise.
steps.content: Watch the sunrise. If you can get outside, then do so. It can be a beautiful sight.

steps.title: Start doing morning things.
steps.content: Start doing morning things. Brush your teeth and if you're going to have a shower, make it colder than usual, to help you to stay awake.
